page.title: 05HENDY QUARRY, MISKIN
page.content: {LANDSCAPE:}On former land owned by Miskin Manor, the quarry is operated by Robert Hobbs Ltd. and is situated between the Manor to the southeast, the site of ancient monastery to the northeast and Miskin village to the west. {ORGANISATION:}It is a hill some 30 metres high, horse-shoe shaped, on 2 levels, with 30 metre faces. The crushing plant is near the road. {PRODUCTS:}The rock is Carboniferous magnesian limestone which is crushed to become chippings or gravel for road construction or building locally. {MARKETS:}Taken by 20 tonne lorries to most parts of South Wales 5 or 6 times a day. The quarry has offices and a vehicle maintenance plant installed next to the crushing plant.
